posts.author: whyareyougeh
posts.title: BEYOND MEAT FILES FOR BANKRUPTCY

posts.raw_content:
If they can do this to Chauvin, they can do it to any of us.

Chauvin was just as innocent as Kyle Rittenhouse. The only difference is optics.

He arrived on the scene after Floyd was already spazzing out. After he had eaten 100x a lethal dose of FENTANYL. All he was told was “code red, drugged out maniac resisting arrest.”

He gets there. He’s only five foot nine, 150 pounds. Tries to get Shaquille O’Neal in the car. He can’t. He tries to prevent Floyd from hitting his head and lets him onto the ground.

Floyd displays all the symptoms of excited delerium and swears he never took any drugs. Chauvin was trained to put his knee on his ~~neck~~ shoulder. He has no other options given Floyd’s gigantic size and strength. He called an ambulance for him.

The ambulance was 20+ min late. Chauvin continued holding down Floyd so he wouldn’t bang his head. Floyd had been saying “I can’t breathe” for 20+ minutes. He cried wolf.

Right before Floyd passes out, the mob threatens Chauvin and starts moving toward him. He has to take out pepper spray to stop them. Only about 30 seconds go by when he continues subduing Floyd after he was out. Anyone can make that mistake — it’s not safe to turn your back to a mob and start giving CPR. It’s not reasonable to expect someone to do this when a mob is saying they’re going to beat the shit out of Chauvin. Again, the ambulance was 20 min late, Chauvin was thinking *they should be here already*

The ambulance arrives and DOES NOT PERFORM CPR. They were too afraid of the mob. They drive a MILE away before doing CPR.

Chauvin did NOTHING wrong. If the communists can arrest you for MURDER and STAB YOU in prison for DOING YOUR JOB BY THE BOOK — then we are ruled by communists.

This won’t be the last time this happens if Trump doesn’t act. He needs to take this issue head on and have his lawyers explain why Chauvin was innocent. Our police are scared shitless to do their jobs now. They only can fire on someone if they’re actively getting shot or stabbed. 

If Chauvin doesn’t get pardoned, the communists won. This is about more than rescuing one innocent man. There will never be law and order in the USA so long as we let this happen.

Shame on anyone trying to throw Chauvin under the bus. This isn’t just a symbolic thing. Chauvin could be out of prison on parole 10 years earlier if the federal charges are dropped. His sentence will be reduced by 2.5 years. Pardon him federally, then elect a Minnesota governor who will pardon him for state crimes.

This is an hill worth dying on. It is a debate we can win. If we don’t win this fight, the communists will inevitably take over our country. Floyd to the left is what Charlie Kirk is to us. We cannot let this delusion continue. Expose the lies. Make sure everyone who isn’t a batshit insane communist knows what happened. FREE DEREK CHAUVIN.

posts.raw_content:
U.S. District Judge Karin J. Immergut serves on the United States District Court for the District of Oregon, a position she has held since her confirmation by the U.S. Senate on July 31, 2019, and receipt of her commission on August 5, 2019.
 She was nominated to the seat by President Donald Trump on June 11, 2018, following the vacancy created by Judge Anna J. Brown assuming senior status.
 Prior to her federal appointment, Immergut served as a judge on the 4th Judicial District Circuit Court in Multnomah County, Oregon, from 2009 to 2019.
 Before that, she was the United States Attorney for the District of Oregon from 2003 to 2009, having previously served as an Assistant U.S. Attorney in both the Central District of California and the District of Oregon.

Immergut is also a judge on the United States Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court, a position to which she was appointed by Chief Justice John Roberts on May 19, 2024, for a seven-year term.
 She has presided over significant cases, including ruling in June 2021 that the National Women's Soccer League's age requirement for professional contracts was unlawful, granting a preliminary injunction to player Olivia Moultrie.
 In March 2023, she granted qualified immunity to a Salem police officer, overturning a jury verdict in a case involving the use of rubber bullets at a protest; however, a panel of the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals later found her decision to be incorrect.
 In July 2023, she upheld Oregon's Measure 114, a gun control law banning large-capacity magazines.
 Most recently, on October 4, 2025, she was scheduled to rule on a request for a temporary restraining order concerning the deployment of the National Guard in Portland, following a hearing on October 3, 2025, where she heard arguments from the City of Portland, the Oregon Department of Justice, and the U.S. Department of Justice.
posts.author: friarfox
posts.title: U.S. District Judge Karin J. Immergut , blocking the national guard deployment to Portland was appointed by Trump in 2019. Here's her info.
posts.content:
U.S. District Judge Karin J. Immergut serves on the United States District Court for the District of Oregon, a position she has held since her confirmation by the U.S. Senate on July 31, 2019, and receipt of her commission on August 5, 2019. She was nominated to the seat by President Donald Trump on June 11, 2018, following the vacancy created by Judge Anna J. Brown assuming senior status. Prior to her federal appointment, Immergut served as a judge on the 4th Judicial District Circuit Court in Multnomah County, Oregon, from 2009 to 2019. Before that, she was the United States Attorney for the District of Oregon from 2003 to 2009, having previously served as an Assistant U.S. Attorney in both the Central District of California and the District of Oregon.

Immergut is also a judge on the United States Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Court, a position to which she was appointed by Chief Justice John Roberts on May 19, 2024, for a seven-year term. She has presided over significant cases, including ruling in June 2021 that the National Women's Soccer League's age requirement for professional contracts was unlawful, granting a preliminary injunction to player Olivia Moultrie. In March 2023, she granted qualified immunity to a Salem police officer, overturning a jury verdict in a case involving the use of rubber bullets at a protest; however, a panel of the 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals later found her decision to be incorrect. In July 2023, she upheld Oregon's Measure 114, a gun control law banning large-capacity magazines. Most recently, on October 4, 2025, she was scheduled to rule on a request for a temporary restraining order concerning the deployment of the National Guard in Portland, following a hearing on October 3, 2025, where she heard arguments from the City of Portland, the Oregon Department of Justice, and the U.S. Department of Justice.
